Yes, there are many prominent musicians today who use their platform for activism and social justice causes. Here are just a few examples:

1. Beyoncé - Singer and actress Beyoncé has been a vocal advocate for women's rights and racial justice, and has used her music and performances to raise awareness of these issues. Her 2016 visual album "Lemonade" addressed themes such as infidelity and black womanhood, and her 2018 Coachella performance paid homage to historically black colleges and universities.

2. John Legend - Singer and songwriter John Legend is an outspoken activist for criminal justice reform and has worked with organizations such as the ACLU and the Free America campaign to advance this cause. He has also campaigned for immigration reform and has been involved in LGBTQ+ advocacy.

3. Lady Gaga - Pop star Lady Gaga is known for her advocacy work on behalf of the LGBTQ+ community and has been a vocal supporter of the Born This Way Foundation, which aims to empower young people and promote mental health awareness. She has also been involved in campaigns to combat sexual assault and has spoken out against systemic racism in the United States.

These musicians, among many others, continue the legacy of artists like Ray Charles who use their fame and influence to promote positive change in the world.
